communications.subject: Your FOIA Request
communications.communication:
August 21, 2025   Re: PARDONFOIA 2024- 308965  Dear Emma North-Best:  While processing your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request dated May 16, 2023, for records concerning Samuel Loring Morison the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) referred a total of 63 pages of clemency-related records to this Office, the Office of the Pardon Attorney (PARDON), for processing and direct response to you. We received these documents on April 2, 2024, and this referral was assigned file number PARDONFOIA 2024-308965. Please refer to this number in any future correspondence with this Office. For your reference, the FBI’s file number associated with this request is FBI FOI/PA # 1590533-000.  Please be advised that we have considered the foreseeable harm standard when reviewing records and applying FOIA exemptions.  After carefully reviewing the clemency-related records maintained in the FBI’s files pertaining to Samuel Loring Morison, we have determined that 62 pages are exempt from disclosure pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(b)(7)(C) , which concerns records or information compiled for law enforcement purposes the release of which could reasonably be expected to constitute an unwarranted invasion of the personal privacy of third parties, as well as U.S.C. § 552(b)(6) , which also concerns material the release of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of the personal privacy of third parties. However, we have determined that 1 page is appropriate for release with redactions pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(b)(6) and/or U.S.C. § 552(b)(7)(C). In addition to the records referred by the FBI, we also searched our own files and located 1 page that is responsive to your request and which we have determined is appropriate for release in full. The releasable record is a copy of the clemency warrant for Samuel Loring Morison.  Due to the age of the case, this disclosure includes all segregable, nonexempt records within our possession or control. All other records from PARDON’s files have been transferred to the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA), and that agency is now the owner of the records (Records of the Office of the Pardon Attorney: https://www.archives.gov/research/guide-fed-records/groups/204.html ). If you have not done so already, you may wish to submit a request directly to NARA for the records you seek at the following address by using the reference number provided above:   National Archives and Records Administration 
Special Access and FOIA Staff 
NWCTF-Room 6350 
8601 Adelphi Road 
College Park, MD 20740 
(866) 272-6272   For your information, Congress excluded three discrete categories of law enforcement and national security records from the requirements of the FOIA. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(c). This response is limited to those records that are subject to the requirements of the FOIA. This is a standard notification that is given to all our requesters and should not be taken as an indication that excluded records do, or do not, exist.  You may email this office at PardonAttorneyFOIA@usdoj.gov for any further assistance with your FOIA request.  Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer. The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov ; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769.  If you are not satisfied with PARDON’s determination in response to this request, you may administratively appeal by writing to the Director, Office of Information Policy (OIP), United States Department of Justice, 441 G Street, NW, 6th Floor, Washington, D.C. 20530, or you may submit an appeal through OIP's FOIA STAR portal by creating an account following the instructions on OIP’s website: https://www.justice.gov/oip/submit-and-track-request-or-appeal . Your appeal must be postmarked or electronically transmitted within 90 days of the date of my response to your request. If you submit your appeal by mail, both the letter and the envelope should be clearly marked "Freedom of Information Act Appeal." If possible, please provide a copy of your original request and this response letter with your appeal.  Sincerely,  Rosalind Sargent-Burns FOIA Public Liaison  Office of the Pardon Attorney

title: Public Records Request – ALPR Hot Lists

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request – ALPR Hot Lists
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1.	A description of all “hot lists” or “custom hot lists” currently maintained for use in Automated License Plate Reader (ALPR) systems.
	
2.	Any policies, agreements, or data-sharing documents identifying external data sources used to populate those lists (e.g., DMV data on suspended/revoked licenses, NCIC, CLETS, Amber Alerts, stolen vehicle databases).
	
3.	The criteria under which plates are added or removed from hot lists.

Please provide documents in electronic form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Concerned Resident

Dear Concerned Resident: 
 
Thank you for submitting a request for public records to Riverside County Sheriff's Department. Your request was received in this office on 8/18/2025 and given the reference number C001586-081825 for tracking purposes. 
 Records Requested: " To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A description of all “hot lists” or “custom hot lists” currently maintained for use in Automated License Plate Reader (ALPR) systems.

2. Any policies, agreements, or data-sharing documents identifying external data sources used to populate those lists (e.g., DMV data on suspended/revoked licenses, NCIC, CLETS, Amber Alerts, stolen vehicle databases).

3. The criteria under which plates are added or removed from hot lists.

Please provide documents in electronic form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Concerned Resident

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Friverside-county-sheriff-806%252Fpublic-records-request-alpr-hot-lists-191542%252F%253Femail%253Driversidesheriff%252540govqa.us&url_auth_token=AAAwWp029-xdo1eMop4h-6A4ap8%3A1uoC2D%3AkmSaiGxndOF1UAGDC-zL4AWDHhAHjrK7x2IkYlXdwcc" 
Pursuant to California Government Code § 7922.535, staff will review your request and respond within 10 days to notify you if there are responsive records, or if an extension is necessary to determine if responsive records exist.  If your request was received after business hours or on a weekend or holiday, the next business day will be considered the date of receipt. The 10-day response period starts with the first calendar day after the date of receipt. (Civ. Code § 10.)  You may be contacted by the department if there are questions regarding your request. 
 
PLEASE NOTE: The California Public Records Act (CPRA) does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Records Request System. 
Riverside County Sheriff's Department

2. Any policies, agreements, or data-sharing documents identifying external data sources used to populate those lists (e.g., DMV data on suspended/revoked licenses, NCIC, CLETS, Amber Alerts, stolen vehicle databases). 

3. The criteria under which plates are added or removed from hot lists. 

Please provide documents in electronic form. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Concerned Resident 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Friverside-county-sheriff-806%252Fpublic-records-request-alpr-hot-lists-191542%252F%253Femail%253Driversidesheriff%252540govqa.us&url_auth_token=AAAwWp029-xdo1eMop4h-6A4ap8%3A1uoC2D%3AkmSaiGxndOF1UAGDC-zL4AWDHhAHjrK7x2IkYlXdwcc" 
The Riverside County Sheriff's Office has reviewed its files and located records responsive to your request.  Please log into your online account to access the ALPR Hot List Report. 
In reference to "Department Policies and Procedures", you may visit the Riverside County Sheriff's Office website at www.riversidesheriff.org.  Click on the Transparency button, scroll down to Department Manual and Policies and click that button.  Scroll down again and you will find the link for the Department Standards Manual (DSM).  Once in the DSM, you can search for any policies and procedures you are inquiring about. 
Please consider this CPRA request closed. 
Sincerely, 

Corr. Sergeant Victoria Miara

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: PRA: Autopsy and coroner’s reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act (Government Code Section 6250 et seq.) ("CPRA”), and all other applicable laws, please disclose the following records.

Any and all autopsy, death investigation, and coroner’s reports relating to the death of:

Name: Jose Soliz, Date of birth: 03-25-1993, Date of death: 11-26-2022

If records pursuant to this request are possessed in machine-readable format such as an .xls, .csv spreadsheet file, please provide the record in this format. Please disclose these records in the format in which they are kept, e.g., .ppt, .pptx, .doc, or .docx.

The fundamental rule of the CPRA is a presumption of public access. “In other words, [A]ll public records are subject to disclosure unless the Legislature has expressly provided to the contrary.” Williams v. Superior Court, 5 Cal. 4th 337 (1993). This presumption finds further support in the California Constitution, as amended by Proposition 59 in 2004. “A statute, court rule, or other authority, including those in effect on the effective date of this subdivision, shall be broadly construed if it furthers the people's right of access, and narrowly construed if it limits the right of access.” Cal. Const. Art. 1 § 3(b)(2).

Please provide a determination on this request within 10 days of your receipt of it. If you determine that any or all of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, please note whether, as is normally the case, the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. If you determine that some but not all of the information is exempt from disclosure and that you intend to withhold it, please redact it for the time being and make the rest available as requested. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any or all of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

Please apply a fee waiver to this request. If the request for a fee waiver is denied, please provide notification of any duplication costs exceeding $50 before you duplicate the records. If the request for a fee waiver is denied, please further provide an index of all other requests since 2018 for which a fee waiver was denied, and the reason therefore.

Please respond to this request and disclose the records electronically by email to this MuckRock email address. Please let us know if you have any questions or if we can help ensure this request is the least burdensome possible for your agency while providing a correct and full disclosure in the public interest.

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to reach out to me via email at sam.levin@theguardian.com or 646-935-9115. 

Thanks so much, 

Sam Levin

title: E & A Occupancy + Fire Sprinkler Information (City Of Schertz)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: E & A Occupancy + Fire Sprinkler Information (City Of Schertz)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request an electronic, parcel-level extract containing current Group E (Educational) and Group A (Assembly) occupancies and associated fire-sprinkler information for all parcels within the jurisdiction: 

Please provide one CSV with the following columns (your native field names are fine):
- Parcel identifier (APN / PIN / BBL)
• Site address (street #, street, city, ZIP)
• Latitude & longitude
• Internal building / permit ID
• Year built
• Floor area (sq ft)
• Number of stories
• Current IBC occupancy code (E, A-1…A-5)
• Occupancy description
• Fire-sprinkler present (Yes / No / Unknown)
• Date of last fire-sprinkler inspection (if tracked)
• Owner name & mailing address (if stored)

If any field is not maintained, please note that rather than withholding the entire record.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Cavise

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Decertification List
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

DCJS's Master Decertification List,  including  but not limited to all pending, final, prior and reinstated police decertification data. 

Data dictionary and documentation 
I also request all documentation that describes the layout of the database’s tables and fields, and that provides the definitions of any field names, codes, and abbreviations used in the database. This information may be gathered together in a single document like a data dictionary, entity layout, or user's guide. If that is the case, I request access to and copy of said document. Should the records above represent certain values as numeric codes or abbreviations that are not self-explanatory, I additionally request all records necessary to interpret those codes and abbreviations.

Data format 
I request these records in their native digital formats and not in formats that degrade the accessibility of the records, such as tabular data converted to PDF or Word files. If converting the native digital format to another high-fidelity format, such as CSV or Excel, please take care not to introduce formatting inconsistencies or errors, which can occur in the conversion process (for example, encoding errors or the inclusion of internal unescaped quotation marks in CSV files).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Dillon Bergin.

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Agreements related to the beverage pouring, distribution, sales or marketing rights for campus, athletics venues or facilities.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly North

communications.subject: Fw: Public Records Request case created: 00371825 - foia
communications.communication:
Kelly,
I am in receipt of your records request as detailed below.

The Massachusetts Public Records Law, M.G.L. Ch. 66, § 10, along with its associated regulations, permits the University to estimate and assess the estimated cost of searching for the requested records or segregating exempt information from non-exempt information.  I estimate that your request took less than four hours to complete and there will be no copying fee charged for this request.  As a result, there will be no fee.

Please see responsive records attached.

Under Chapter 66 of the General Laws, you have the right to appeal our disposition of your request to the Supervisor of Public Records, Office of the Secretary of State, pre@sec.state.ma.us<mailto:pre@sec.state.ma.us>  and the right to seek judicial review of an unfavorable decision by commencing a civil action in the superior court under subsection (c) of section 10A.

Thanks,
Christine

Christine M. Wilda

title: Seattle Digital Kiosks: Seattle IT Surveillance Impact Report (SIR) and Privacy Review

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Seattle Digital Kiosks: Seattle IT Surveillance Impact Report (SIR) and Privacy Review
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Since January 1, 2023:
1. The complete Surveillance Impact Report (SIR) – whether draft or final – and any equivalent privacy assessments, data governance plans, or security reviews conducted by or for Seattle IT regarding the IKE Smart City / Downtown Seattle Association digital kiosk proposal.
2. All correspondence (including emails and attachments) between Seattle IT and the Community Surveillance Working Group (CSWG) regarding the review of, or feedback on, the IKE Smart City digital kiosk proposal.
3. All communications (including emails and attachments) between any leadership or staff of Seattle IT involved in the review of the digital kiosk project and the Office of the Mayor (including Tim Burgess) regarding the proposal, its surveillance features, privacy implications, or compliance with city ordinances.
4. Any documents reflecting directives, guidance, or inquiries received from the Office of the Mayor concerning the evaluation or approval timeline of the digital kiosk project.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Phil Mocek

communications.communication:
Dear Phil Mocek, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C226786-052325 received on May 23, 2025 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV25-C226786-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center.
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C226786-052325. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV25-C226786-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net)

communications.subject: Seattle Information Technology :: C226786-052325
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Dear Phil Mocek, 
Records are now available in response to your request C226786-052325 regarding the following: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Since January 1, 2023: 
1. The complete Surveillance Impact Report (SIR) – whether draft or final – and any equivalent privacy assessments, data governance plans, or security reviews conducted by or for Seattle IT regarding the IKE Smart City / Downtown Seattle Association digital kiosk proposal. 
2. All correspondence (including emails and attachments) between Seattle IT and the Community Surveillance Working Group (CSWG) regarding the review of, or feedback on, the IKE Smart City digital kiosk proposal. 
3. All communications (including emails and attachments) between any leadership or staff of Seattle IT involved in the review of the digital kiosk project and the Office of the Mayor (including Tim Burgess) regarding the proposal, its surveillance features, privacy implications, or compliance with city ordinances. 
4. Any documents reflecting directives, guidance, or inquiries received from the Office of the Mayor concerning the evaluation or approval timeline of the digital kiosk project. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Phil Mocek 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdepartment-of-information-technology-795%252Fseattle-digital-kiosks-seattle-it-surveillance-impact-report-sir-and-privacy-review-186992%252F%253Femail%253Ditd_pdr%252540seattle.gov&url_auth_token=AAAdowgnaKBPYU4SDgFbogPxe2I%3A1uIeYp%3Ah3ht8pUzXYAR8LsL16BZho-nLGF_0WvNgvNrVCHkUng 
The records being made available to you at this time include the following: All correspondence surrounding . IKE Smart City / Downtown Seattle Association digital kiosk proposal 
Apologies for the delay. There has been a changeover in staff that handles the accounting records for the Information Technology Department, and they were not aware of protocol to inform public records officers of checks received for requests. 
To download your records, please: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center.
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Select this request: C226786-052325. 
  * Select the 'View Files' button. 
  * You can download records individually or all at the same time by clicking 'Download All'. 
  *  Please save your records as you may only download them from the system three times. If you do not download your records within 30 days of request closure, the link to your records will expire. 
If you believe you have received privileged or confidential records in error, please notify the City of Seattle immediately, through the Public Records Request Center or by email. Privileged or confidential records provided or received in error should not be reviewed, used, disseminated, distributed, or copied, and should be destroyed immediately. Thank you in advance for your cooperation. 
The Information Technology Department has now provided all responsive records. We consider your request closed and plan to take no further action to fulfill this request. If you have any follow-up questions or would like to initiate an administrative appeal under MDAR 17-0002 Section 6, please contact us within 10 business days after downloading your records, after which this request will no longer be monitored for communications. You may also seek judicial review of our response to your request for a period of one year, beginning as of the date of this message, consistent with RCW 42.56.550. 
Sincerely, 
Information Technology Department

title: Library Contract Request: Nexis Uni (University of Northern Iowa)

communications.subject: Iowa Open Records Law Request: Library Contract Request: Nexis Uni (University of Northern Iowa)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Iowa Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The library's most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with library vendor Lexis Nexis relating to the licensing of the library database Nexis Uni; and

All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent in the library's or university's possession; and

All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations with language governing the use of the library database Nexis Uni in the library's or university's possession; and

All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations with language governing the use of the library database Nexis Uni in the library's or university's possession.

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of the library database Nexis Uni in the library's or university's possession.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

mo

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: N2: Personnel Files, Waters + Tubman
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals:

Peter A Rutkowski, Principal
Tonya Hammaker, Principal

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums and interview summary reports, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), incident reports, EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements.

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=17814

RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please note that certain private information (personal descriptions, employee ID numbers, college transcripts, social security numbers, citizenship status, signatures, personal addresses, medical information, etc.) was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a) exempts “ information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State Law … ” (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) Specifically, 105 ILCS 5/10-21.9 (b) states that “ any information concerning the record of convictions obtained by the president of the school board or the regional superintendent shall be confidential and may only be transmitted to the superintendent of the school district or his designee, the appropriate regional superintendent if the check was requested by the school district, the presidents of the appropriate school boards if the check was requested from the Department of State Police by the regional superintendent, the State Superintendent of Education, the State Teacher Certification Board, any other person necessary to the decision of hiring the applicant for employment, or for clarification purposes the Department of State Police or Statewide Sex Offender Database, or both.” 
Portions of this request that include personnel evaluations are redacted entirely in accordance with section 7(1)(a) of FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) which exempts from public release information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law and also in accordance with section 7.5(q) of the FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7.5(q)) which exempts from public release information prohibited from being disclosed by the Personnel Records Review Act [820 ILCS 40/0.01 et seq.] Redactions have been made pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5 (r), which exempts from inspection or copying information prohibited from being disclosed by the Illinois School Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA prohibits the disclosure of students and any student records in which a student may be individually identified by a school regardless of how or where the information pursuant to (105 ILCS 10/2(d). 
Please also note that certain incident report entries related to this request are being withheld entirely pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a). This section exempts from disclosure information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law. Specifically, the Abused and Neglected Child Reporting Act, section 325 ILCS 5/1, states that all records concerning reports of child abuse and neglect or records concerning referrals under this Act and all records generated as a result of such reports or referrals, shall be confidential and shall not be disclosed except as specifically authorized by this Act or other applicable law; and 820 ILCS 40/13 of the Illinois Personnel Records Review Act, which prohibits the identification of individuals who are the subject of an unfounded DCFS report. Identities of complainants have been redacted pursuant to section 7(d)(iv) of the FOIA which exempts confidential information furnished only by the confidential source, or persons who file complaints with or provide information to administrative, investigative, law enforcement, or penal agencies. You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: ALPR audit (Glen Carbon Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Concerning Flock Safety, these files;

1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me;
3b. Networks that I’m sharing.

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Scott Kampas

title: N.C. Active Law Enforcement Officers Certification History

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: N.C. Actice Law Enforcement Officers Certification History
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

an electronic copy of the certification history for all currently active law enforcement officers in North Carolina. Specifically, I am seeking a complete spreadsheet containing, for each such officer’s certification record, the following fields:

Name
Academy ID number (as used in the ACADIS database)
Employing agency
Certification issue date
Certification status (active, inactive, revoked, etc.)
Separation date (if the certification status is now inactive)
Reason for separation (if the certification status is now inactive)

This request covers all time periods for which each active officer has been certified; no date range limitation is needed because I am interested in the full certification history of anyone who is currently active as a law enforcement officer. If any portion of these records is withheld as exempt, I request that you segregate any exempt material and release the rest. If possible, please provide the records in an electronic spreadsheet or database format (e.g. Excel or CSV).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Lucas

communications.subject: Re: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: N.C. Actice Law Enforcement Officers Certification History

Sincerely,

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Values Act
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am requesting data and documents related to the California VALUES Act: 

Government Code section 7284.6, subdivision (c)(1) requires California LEAs that participate in a joint law enforcement task force, for which the California LEA has agreed to dedicate personnel or resources on an ongoing basis, to submit a report annually to the DOJ.

I am requesting that data broken down by department and include the required information: (1) the purpose of the task force; (2) the federal, state, and local agencies involved in the task force; (3) the total number of arrests made by the task force during the reporting period; and (4) the total number of arrests made by the task force for immigration enforcement purposes; i.e., any arrests by the task force for any violation of any provisions of the federal Immigration and Nationality Act, which is found in Title 8 of the United States Code.1

Also, include data required by Government Code section 7284.6, subdivision (c)(2) requires all California LEAs (not limited to California LEAs participating in a task force) to report the number of transfers the California LEA makes to immigration authorities in a calendar year, as permitted by Section 7284.6, subdivision (a)(4), and the offense that allowed for the transfer. This information shall also be reported to the DOJ by January 15, 2019, and annually on this date thereafter. 

I understand Annual Reports are created, I am seeking the data used in the reports. 

Include copies of submitted reports from each department, including each Form BCIIS-SB54-1, Form BCIIS-SB54-1A, and Form BCIIS-5854-2. The reports and forms can be released second on a rolling basis. 

Search from 2019 to today's date.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Rifle inventory records (Riverside County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Records of the most recent inventory of rifles possessed by the Sheriff's Office, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code (assault rifles, patrol rifles, sniper rifles, .50 caliber rifles).
2. Records indicating the number of rifles, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code,  privately possessed by personnel of the Sheriff's Office with its authorization, OR the number of Sheriff's Office personnel with such authorization.

To assist with the prompt release of responsive material, I ask that you make records available to me as you locate them, rather than waiting until all responsive records have been collected and copied.
 
The requested documents or information from them will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

If you would like to discuss these requests, please feel free to reach out to me, John Lindsay-Poland, co-director of the American Friends Service Committee California Healing Justice Program at jlindsay-poland@afsc.org or by phone at 510-282-8983.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

 Records Requested: " To Whom It May Concern:

To assist with the prompt release of responsive material, I ask that you make records available to me as you locate them, rather than waiting until all responsive records have been collected and copied.

The requested documents or information from them will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

If you would like to discuss these requests, please feel free to reach out to me, John Lindsay-Poland, co-director of the American Friends Service Committee California Healing Justice Program at jlindsay-poland@afsc.org or by phone at 510-282-8983.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

John Lindsay-Poland

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Friverside-county-sheriff-806%252Frifle-inventory-records-riverside-county-sheriff-190896%252F%253Femail%253Driversidesheriff%252540govqa.us&url_auth_token=AAAwWp029-xdo1eMop4h-6A4ap8%3A1ulgg3%3AFO1TPd0yy_AuigmZy-z5N4MWK_LTuJwicycsulCKKv8" 
Pursuant to California Government Code § 7922.535, staff will review your request and respond within 10 days to notify you if there are responsive records, or if an extension is necessary to determine if responsive records exist.  If your request was received after business hours or on a weekend or holiday, the next business day will be considered the date of receipt. The 10-day response period starts with the first calendar day after the date of receipt. (Civ. Code § 10.)  You may be contacted by the department if there are questions regarding your request. 
 
PLEASE NOTE: The California Public Records Act (CPRA) does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Records Request System. 
Riverside County Sheriff's Department

communications.subject: TEMPLATEFOIA Service Request Updated :: C001524-081125
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: Public Records Request of August 11, 2025, Reference # C001524-081125 

Dear John Lindsay-Poland, 

On August 11, 2025, the Riverside County Sheriff's Office received your request for records under the California Public Records Act (CPRA) wherein you requested the following: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

1. Records of the most recent inventory of rifles possessed by the Sheriff's Office, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code (assault rifles, patrol rifles, sniper rifles, .50 caliber rifles). 
2. Records indicating the number of rifles, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code, privately possessed  by personnel of the Sheriff's Office with its authorization, OR the number of Sheriff's Office personnel with such authorization. 
To assist with the prompt release of responsive material, I ask that you make records available to me as you locate them, rather than waiting until all responsive records have been collected and copied. 

The requested documents or information from them will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

If you would like to discuss these requests, please feel free to reach out to me, John Lindsay-Poland, co-director of the American Friends Service Committee California Healing Justice Program at jlindsay-poland@afsc.org or by phone at 510-282-8983. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

John Lindsay-Poland 

Please note the Riverside County Sheriff's Office response below had been numbered according to your request for clarity. 
***Specific to Item #1*** 
We have located the records responsive to your request, and those records are available in the Records Request System.  Please log in to your online account to retrieve the records. 
***Specific to Item #2*** 
The Riverside County Sheriff's Office does not track personally owned weapons by Sheriff deputies/officers. 
The number of deputies with authorization to carry a California designated assault weapon is approximately 3,600 as all sworn deputies are authorized to carry such weapons. 

Please consider this CPRA request closed. 

Sincerely, 

Corr. Sergeant Victoria Miara 
CPRA Unit 
Riverside County Sheriff's Office

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to Section 149.43 of the Ohio Revised Code, I hereby request the following records:  unofficial copies of any documents of complaints and actions taken (any info allowable by law) filed with the Ohio Charitable Law regarding :
Temple Sholom of Cincinnati (doing business as that has lapsed)
Formerly Congregation Sholom
EIN 31-0584318
10828 Kenwood Rd. Cincinnati, OH 45242


I request that I be properly classified as a news media requester. I am a complainant and a writer for the Times of Israel and I am requesting this information in that editorial capacity.  The Times of Israel is widely recognized for its reporting, publishing regular features on issues of public interest and importance.  You may view my articles at the address listed:  https://blogs.timesofisrael.com/author/julie-guilfoyle/

If you have any questions about my media status, please contact me.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.  If there is a large cost, then as an alternative, I request for the records to be made available for inspection.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request.

Sincerely,
Julie Guilfoyle

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Julie Guilfoyle

title: Request on Political Appointees (Small Business Administration)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request on Political Appointees (Small Business Administration)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act. I hereby request the following records:

1. A list of any and all political appointments at the agency appointed from January 20, 2025 until the date of your final response to this request.

2. Copies of resumes for any and all political appointees hired since January 20, 2025 until the date of your final response to this request. These records are likely in the possession of the Designated Agency Ethics Official (DAEO).

Please provide these records as available on a rolling basis.

Documented is an investigative watchdog and reporting group that explores the relationship between special interests and government. This request is likely to contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of the operations of the government. Disclosure of the requested records serves the public interest, and this request is not being made for any commercial purposes. Therefore, I am requesting a waiver of any fees. If you do not grant my fee waiver request, please notify me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically by email attachment or other electronic file transfer if available, or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.  I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Nina

Greetings,

This correspondence is to acknowledge that we are in receipt of your public records request, received below.  We are in the process of identifying the responsive materials related to your request.  Once we have completed this process, we will notify you if there are associated costs as permitted under the Florida public records laws, section 119.07, Florida Statutes, for which you may be responsible for prior to release of the records.

In the interim, please feel free to contact me with any questions.

Cordially,

Sandy Zablackas | Legal Assistant III

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: William M. Beecher (May 27, 1933 – February 9, 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into investigative journalist William M. Beecher (May 27, 1933 – February 9, 2024). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/02/18/business/media/william-beecher-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an investigative journalist who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest for the Daily Beast, the Asia Times, Responsible Statecraft, the National Interest, Reason Magazine, America Magazine and the Armenian Weekly, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1620220-000
communications.communication:
To whom this may concern,

My name is Matthew Petti and I am writing in response to my FOIA request number 1620220-000. Thank you so much for your prompt response.

In your letter dated 6 March 2024, you write that "additional records potentially responsive to your subject may exist. If this release of previously processed material does not satisfy your request, you may request an additional search for records."

I would like to formally advise that I would like an additional search for records. Thank you again for your prompt attention to this matter. If possible, please let me know if you've received this message.

Best regards,
Matthew

communications.subject: FOIA Request 1620220-001/William Beecher
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

We're contacting you in reference to the FOIPA request number included in the subject line of this email.  The FBI located approximately 2,083 pages potentially responsive to your request. 

Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system:
Extra-small track requests (0-50 pages) current average time is approximately 8 months to complete;
Small track requests (51-250 pages) current average time is approximately 36 months to complete;
Medium track requests (251-500 pages) current average time is approximately 44 months to complete;
Large track requests (501-4,999 pages) current average time is approximately 67 months to complete; and
Extra-large track requests (5,000+ pages) current average time is approximately 79 months to complete.

The current average time to complete your large track request is at least 67 months. Reducing the scope of your request may accelerate the processing, allow for a timelier receipt of the information you seek, and reduce the duplication costs, if applicable.  Would you be willing to consider reducing the scope of your request to place it in a smaller, potentially faster processing track?

Please let us know if this is something you would be interested in further discussing. If you chose to narrow the scope of your request, you will be able to request remaining material via a new FOIPA request submission at the completion of this request, subject to applicable fees.

Respectfully,

Negotiation Team
Federal Bureau of Investigation
Fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov<mailto:Fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov>

Status Checks: https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__vault.fbi.gov_fdps-2D1_-40-40search-2Dfdps&d=DwMFAw&c=sJ6xIWYx-zLMB3EPkvcnVg&r=XBMMkObpUV4qgiRWe16ruf84MlE_zzfeACVcd84hmls&m=Aw62oYIKH07oNuehHecdHgLWMqlWFG0DYoQjNpzMHkhbi3BtoiHrci3yBRh212Wp&s=SdHEKbKopxbZbSeRluCcd86nmwJXks1SzF_CE3LxaTE&e=> | foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>
For additional information, please visit the www.fbi.gov/foia<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3A__www.fbi.gov_foia&d=DwMFAw&c=sJ6xIWYx-zLMB3EPkvcnVg&r=XBMMkObpUV4qgiRWe16ruf84MlE_zzfeACVcd84hmls&m=Aw62oYIKH07oNuehHecdHgLWMqlWFG0DYoQjNpzMHkhbi3BtoiHrci3yBRh212Wp&s=-aTlmvcM5Bk6Q7nyu9yDBhN3v2HmU3sGIZ7u9r2JLFg&e=> website.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1620220-001
communications.communication:
Dear Negotiation Team,

I hope this message finds you well. My name is Matthew Petti and I am writing with regard to my FOIA request number 1620220-001/William Beecher. Do you have any suggestions on how to reduce the scope of the request? Otherwise, I am happy to leave it in the large track.

Sincerely,
Matthew

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1620220-001
communications.communication:
Good morning,
Thank you for your email concerning the scope reduction of this request.  Unfortunately, we are limited on what we can discuss since the potentially responsive pages haven’t been reviewed by a FOIA analyst.
After further review, the potentially responsive pages are within the date range of 1953-1987.
We recommend the following options:

We could narrow the scope of this request by limiting to a specific date range within 1953-1987.

We could reduce the scope of this request by limiting to approximately 50 potentially responsive pages.  This request would move to the simple track with an average time to complete of approximately 8 months.

We could reduce the scope of this request by limiting to approximately 250 potentially responsive pages.  This request would move to the small track with an average time to complete of approximately 36 months.

We could reduce the scope of this request by limiting to approximately 500 potentially responsive pages.  This request would move to the medium track with an average time to complete of approximately 44 months.

Please let us know how you would like to move forward with reducing the scope of your request.
Respectfully,

Negotiation Team
Federal Bureau of Investigation
Fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov<mailto:Fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov>

Status Checks: https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__vault.fbi.gov_fdps-2D1_-40-40search-2Dfdps&d=DwMFAw&c=sJ6xIWYx-zLMB3EPkvcnVg&r=XBMMkObpUV4qgiRWe16ruf84MlE_zzfeACVcd84hmls&m=Aw62oYIKH07oNuehHecdHgLWMqlWFG0DYoQjNpzMHkhbi3BtoiHrci3yBRh212Wp&s=SdHEKbKopxbZbSeRluCcd86nmwJXks1SzF_CE3LxaTE&e=> | foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>
For additional information, please visit the www.fbi.gov/foia<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3A__www.fbi.gov_foia&d=DwMFAw&c=sJ6xIWYx-zLMB3EPkvcnVg&r=XBMMkObpUV4qgiRWe16ruf84MlE_zzfeACVcd84hmls&m=Aw62oYIKH07oNuehHecdHgLWMqlWFG0DYoQjNpzMHkhbi3BtoiHrci3yBRh212Wp&s=-aTlmvcM5Bk6Q7nyu9yDBhN3v2HmU3sGIZ7u9r2JLFg&e=> website.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1620220-001
communications.communication:
Dear Negotiation Team,

I hope this message finds you well. This is Matthew Petti, writing with regard to my Freedom of Information Act Request #1620220-001. What would the page count look like if I limited it to records from 1975 onwards?

Sincerely,
Matthew

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1620220-001
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Thank you for your email.  If we reduce the scope of this request to documents from 1975-1987, there would be 4 potentially responsive pages.  Is there are track size you are interested in move this request to?  Some requesters opt to narrow the request to the first or most recent 50 pages for a simple track request.  We can go up to 250 pages for a small track request, or up to 500 for a medium track request.

Please advise how you would like to proceed.
Respectfully,

Negotiation Team
Federal Bureau of Investigation
Fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov<mailto:Fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov>

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Dolores Leschuck Open Records Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Sir or Madam:

I am submitting this letter in order to request all documents, public information and public records related to Case ID 25000541, described below.  Please be advised that this request is hereby submitted pursuant to The Texas Open Records Act, Texas Government Code Chapter 552, and The Federal Freedom of Information Act.  I would like to request that all such public information and records be produced as soon as possible.  Please be advised that your agency will be paid the requisite fees, in accordance with the Open Records Act, with respect to your compliance with this request for the production of public records and documents.

Our office represents Dolores Leschuck in regard to injuries she sustained in an automobile accident  on April 9, 2025 at approximately 5:48 PM.  The location of the accident was 21100 SE H.K. Dodgen Loop, Temple TX.  The public information and documents which I am requesting at this time (including information that is collected, assembled, or maintained under a law or ordinance or in connection with the transaction of official business by or for a government body, which included the media on which the public information is recorded, paper, film, magnetic, optical, and/or solid state device that can store an electronic signal; tape; computer disk; etc.) are as follows:

•	Any video or photographs taken at the scene of the collision, or in the officer’s cruiser,
 
•	Any bodycam footage captured by responding officers,

•	Any witness statements, handwritten notes, or supplemental accident report information, 

•	An audio copy of the 911 calls from witnesses who called in to report this accident, along with any witness names, addresses, and phone numbers that may be in possession of the communications center, along with any police reports that correspond to this particular incident. 

•	Copies of all sketches, diagrams, witness statements and/or names and phone numbers of witnesses at the scene who did not give statements that may be in the possession of your department.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Vic Feazell

communications.subject: Your City of Temple TX public records request #25-1432 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
City of Temple TX ************************************************************************ Your record request #25-1432 has been submitted successfully. Your request will be processed accordingly. You will need to log in and activate your account to view this request. If there are any exceptions to disclosure which pertain to the release of any of the documents or records you have requested, the Texas Public Information Act (PIA) requires that the City submit arguments to the Texas Attorney General within 10 business days from receiving your request, and the Attorney General has 45 business days to issue a ruling regarding the applicable exceptions to disclosure. Information that is determined to be not subject to an exception under the PIA, or documents which are deemed releasable after receiving the Attorney General’s ruling, will be released to you promptly. For future requests please submit them online at https://cityoftempletx.nextrequest.com/ ****Providing an email address when submitting a request will help prevent delays by allowing the electronic release of responsive documents.**** ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact City of Temple TX.

title: Rifle inventory records (Stanislaus County Sheriff's Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Rifle inventory records (Stanislaus County Sheriff's Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Records of the most recent inventory of rifles possessed by the Sheriff's Office, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code (assault rifles, patrol rifles, sniper rifles, .50 caliber rifles).
2. Records indicating the number of rifles, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code,  privately possessed by personnel of the Sheriff's Office with its authorization, OR the number of Sheriff's Office personnel with such authorization.

To assist with the prompt release of responsive material, I ask that you make records available to me as you locate them, rather than waiting until all responsive records have been collected and copied.
 
The requested documents or information from them will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

If you would like to discuss these requests, please feel free to reach out to me, John Lindsay-Poland, co-director of the American Friends Service Committee California Healing Justice Program at jlindsay-poland@afsc.org or by phone at 510-282-8983.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

communications.subject: Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act Request: Police disciplinary files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

title: Library Contract Request: ProQuest Ebook Central (Middlesex County College)

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Library Contract Request: ProQuest Ebook Central (Middlesex County College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with Clarivate / ProQuest relating to the licensing of ProQuest Ebook Central;
All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and
All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the contractual relations with Clarivate / ProQuest for ebook licensing. 

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of ProQuest Ebook Central.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

smhc

communications.subject: RE: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Library Contract Request: ProQuest Ebook Central (Middlesex County College)
communications.communication:
Hello,

Thank you for your response and for the 2025-26 ProQuest renewal document, including eBook Central.

I am following up to request all contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, and other agreement documents, in addition to renewal notices, for the use of ProQuest resources (including eBook Central) that are in effect any time between 7/1/2025 and 6/30/2026.

Thank you,
smhc

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Agreements related to the beverage pouring, distribution, sales or marketing rights for campus, athletics venues or facilities.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly North

title: Guides, policies and trainings on electronic federal records

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Guides, policies and trainings on electronic federal records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All guides, memos or briefings on storing and handling electronic records, including but not limited to text messages, as federal records. 

- All polices on storing and handling electronic records, including but not limited to text messages, as federal records. 

-  All employee training materials on storing and handling electronic records, including but not limited to text messages, as federal records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin
